I used to play this game a lot. It even was, in fact, my favourite multiplayer. Which has sadly changed since the last update on the 8th of December 2015.   It is undeniably a very unique game & most likely the fastest paced FPS in the world. What makes this game so gorgeous is not only its creativity with the gameplay, mechanics and weapons, but also a certain simplicity: There is a concept, but no campaign, no special missions. Just the good old gameplay you find in every server.  FPS are naturally repeatitive, that's not a secret, but what is crucial is its capability to keep combats versatile and allow players to shape the battle for it to never become boring and this game managed to do this oh so well.   What I truly love about this game is:    1) The quick progress. You are paid very well for your success and the awards you receive for certain actions are limitless. Just by playing for, let's say... 7-9 hours, throughout 3 days, for instance, you have already made some big progress. Some weapons might be very expensive, but everything is affordable. This is nowhere near being a Pay2Win game. And the levelling was also quite quick. You get to max out your armour, your weapons and gadgets after a few days of playing. But it always depends, it depends on how well you actually do... Good weapons don't automatically put you head-on with the pros & here's my second point:   2) The importance of one's skills. No matter how many guns you have & how badass youn look in your fancy skins, you don't get to kill someone who's passing by at 350km/h with a spinfusor if you don't even know what you're doing. It really takes training to be good at this game & every weapon is unique and most of them, if not all, are really good in their own ways. But, of course, it also depends on the user whether it is any good. Maybe you like it firey, maybe precise, maybe heavy with a lot of lasers and light effects. And this has also something to do with:   3) The weapons simply being unique. If you have played Warframe before, or any MMO RPG, you will obviously encounter weapons that are clearly & simply in every aspect objectively stronger than other 'low tier' weapons. For instance, starting of with an apprentice staff in WOW, you won't ever be able to kill the Lich King with that thing. Or starting off with the Skana in Warframe, you will, at some point, receive the broken war & notice that every stat is just green and much higher when you compare it with the Skana.  Not in mother♥♥♥♥ing Tribes, because these weapons have their own strengths. It's not like in Warframe, where you just have a stronger weapon to kill stronger enemies the exact same ♥♥♥♥ing way as ever; 'Click-click-Dead' (And their powers are just fancier ways to get done with the enemies, let's be honest) In this game, you are everything that matters! Hell, you can even kill an experienced gamer with a n00b gun, if you know how to do it. Sure, some weapons deal more damage than others, but that doesn't make them objectively stronger! Some are explosives, other are rifles, some are disc shooters, some have splash damage, higher fire rates, and overall completely different projectiles and/or ways to deal damage!   This is not about the guns, the armour, the vehicles, this is about you, the player, and how well you do with what you have to choose from!   It took a lot to ruin this game for me and here's what it was:  The update introduced some really interesting new mechanics to the game. The greatest being the completely free customisation, others being rebalanced weapons, new weapons and also, a bunch of new maps were introduced.  The customisation is really exciting, actually. One gets to choose from the three armour classes and the rest is completely up to them, with some restrictions, obviously, and specification on the armour types.  Look, I don't think it's good or bad. It is some progress, yes, but personally, I preferred the old system. It just felt right to me, it gave some feeling, meaning and life tothe classes, I'd say, and a role to the player using them. Those roles were renderred completely redundant after the update, though, because everyone was unique, which is obviously not bad, of course. It is something I love about the game Angels Fall First, for instance, where the customisation is just like that, but to me, it just doesn't fit in the game. Like I said, this is completely subjective.  What is definitelly not subjective, but just straight up bad, useless, yeah even gamebreaking, is the removal of the Perks, some weapons and the levelling/upgrading system. Lordy, do I even need to comment on that?  Starting off with the guns: I understand why some guns were balanced, some clearly needed to be. The Nova Colt, especially, I guess we all can agree. I hope, however, that none were nerfed that did not deserved to be nerfed. I haven't come across one, so far. I really love that they added new ones, but maybe the blinkfusors being available for all classes makes the game a bit unbalanced. Not too sure though.  But actually removing some? I really don't see why they should. The ones that were removed seemed totally fine, at least to me. Ah yes, I remember, several class-specific guns were removed, for instance one the Raider used. Why would they remove that? The reduced freedom to choose only generalises the custom builds more. But the ones that ♥♥♥♥♥♥ me off the most being removed were the MKII versions of the start weapons. As you may know, every class receives a certain preset of weapons to use, until one earns enough to buy better equipment and every onne of those start weapons has a stronger version of them. Basically the exact same (mostly), but just stronger in several ways, mostly damage.  Well, those were removed and that's complete ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t to me. Because not only is that one thing bad enough, but also the fact that the levelling/upgrading system was removed! Renderring every weapon weak and sometimes useless. You know, you were able to upgrade your weapons by simply using them in combat and gaining experience with them, which made them stronger, but you were also able to pay to max it out. Welp, that is gone now and you might think... the most logical thing to do would be to leave them in the state they would be when they're maxed, right? Well, NOPE, cuz mother♥♥♥♥ing High-Rez nerfed'em all. You receive a weapon in the level 1 state and it stays like that forever.  Look, they level up quickly and after a few days, ♥♥♥♥ing everyone on the battlefield is using maxed out weapons. It is fair for everyone involved and the ones using low-tier weapons aren't put into that much of a disadvantage though. Even if, they could still choose to join a noob server. Nobody would complain! So in the end, the weapons are only low-tier for like 5% of their time used and will stay maxed out for the rest of your life! Probably 90% of the guns used in a battle are already maxed out and nobody is really in a disadvantage. And nobody is used to using these low-tier weapons with lower damage, smaller clips, less magazines, shorter range and sooo much more, it's ridiculous...  But the most ridiculous thing is that this also affects armour, packs and perks. The armours will stay that weak, the packs will stay as inefficient and so on...  But actually removing the perks just made everything go to ♥♥♥♥. It used to offer SO much versatility and many special passive or active abilities to enhance one's usefulness in combat! Now nobody has any special abilities anymore, everyone is weaker, no more additional energy or less mass... But do you know how ridiculous it is to run around with just one ♥♥♥♥ing mine and having to constantly resupply because of the lack of upgrades and perks? That, people, is the most ridiculous part of it all, if you ask me.  High-Rez, you broke the game. Thank you very much.
Poor Tribes. It didn't deserve to die that way.

I used to play this game a lot from 2013 to the end of 2015 and loved it, but I stopped, you might ask 'why did you stop?'. Well to put it in simple terms, this game was comepletely ruined when it got updated in 2015.  It was a great game back then and it had a lot of potential, but unfortunately HiRez abandoned it, which seemed like a stupid decision to the thousands on thousands of players, but it made sense too since they were losing money. What really destroyed this game was its attempt to reboot it with a supposedly 'good' update. But it was a complete flop, the update removed lots of our favourite weapons and merged all the original classes into just 3. Ever since that the game has gone downhill, I, as well as a lot of people I knew, left the game. All of this happened purely because HiRez didn't listen to player feedback, especially from the top and long-time players (I was Devilshouse - you may remember me).  But one thing that can never fail to entertain in this game is the voice chat.

Before launch, this game had me really excited, even became a 'VIP' contributor (before this game hit steam +150 hours). It was tribes, but it didnt feel like tribes that much. The vast amount of automatic weapons was just mindblowing, in a bad way. It was like the devs was trying to make CoD on jetpacks. Some complained and some gave good feedback about various aspects of the game, but the devs just didn't listen. Even though the feedback was given by veteran tribes players! And now it seems like the game has been left to rot.  It feels like a good genre has been touched by something foul and tainted.  You might enjoy it, if you haven't played any other tribes games. If you have played tribes 2 or T:V, you might enjoy it for awhile, but in the end, it won't feel like tribes.

Hi-Rez has to be one of the shadiest game devs out there. They have abandoned T:A to work on their MOBA money-grab, SMITE, full-time. T:A is left in a bug-filled, unbalanced state.  The Starsiege:Tribes Franchise was known for its high-skill ceiling, complex Flag-running tactics, sheer speed (thanks to jetpacks, rocket-jumping, and the 'skiing' mechanic) and high-level competitive play. Throwing the flag to a teammate while you're both mid-air, flying at high-speed along different vectors... the games were white-knuckle, high speed action.  Once custom servers get up and going, and you can enjoy it the way previous Tribes games were meant to be enjoyed, then it might be a worth-while investment of your time.  But don't give any more money to Hi-Rez. They're shady as #*$&.

I actually played a lot of this game when it first came out, and it looked to be going well for a while. HiRez were chipping in pot bonuses for tournaments, promoting the game on streams and such, it could have been good.  Frankly the game had and has too many flaws to write an all-encompassing review including all of its many faults, but among the highlights have to be HiRez' complete lack of common sense, vision for the final product, and inability to listen to feedback from top players, even on trivial matters (I recall a forum thread pleading for replay-support, where some HiRez employee came in to basically say 'we could do this, but we won't'), the redesigns and gross mismanagement of classes/loadouts, lack of decent balance for certain weapons, the GOTTA GO SLOW, the menu UI, the game's performance, the grind, the lies, the microtransactions, the...really, it's The Everything.  Then, years after the game had been aborted, they (I think it was like 1 rogue developer with community feedback and a lack of Jesus in his life) release a patch that is half idiocy and half comp mod, and now even the casuals who stuck with this mess for years don't wanna play the game anymore.  If you actually want a history lesson on why this game is dead,  here you go . It's a fantastic tale of incompetence.  Despite all of this. the game could be fun for new players as a f2p title, if it had players.  It doesn't.  [steamcharts.com]  For good reason. Even the very few players it has are undeserved and probably nostalgic/poor people.

It really pains my heart to have to review Tribes: Ascend like this.  The core mechanics are quite solid and the skiing is undoubtedly the thing that drew me to this game the most. The maps are varied and distinct and make for some very fun team gameplay.  But with Hi-Rez's discontinuation of support and the shortage of players, it's simply not worth trying out. You won't find enough people to play with to fill a team, and being on a server with one other person just isn't any fun.  It's a shame because the skiing is definitely where Ascend becomes something of its own and not just another shooter, and it's sad to think that it will likely not appear outside of Ascend for some time.

Hi-Rez installs their own root level service. Remember the expensive class action Sony lost for installing rootkits? Their shrink wrap EULA didn't save them.  Hi-Rez advises people to turn off their UAC, anti-virus and firewall. Is that advice bad enough to be held liable? It's right there on their website.  Hi-Rez installs Flash. Did you see the latest list of Flash exploits? Pretty much their entire history they've been enabling malware and exploits.  Hi-Rez and anyone else who installs malware like programs and gives malware enabling advice should be suspended from Steam until they remove the offending code. Repeat offenses should result in a ban. That's what Apple and Google do to keep their market clean.  For the record, I love Tribes 1 & 2. Ascend used to be OK but had input lag even on a 4GHz machine. Unfortunately, the new patch nerfs defense so bad it turns Ascend into a bum rush & spawn camping game like 99% of the other online games. The armor configuration method is also incredibly bad, resembling a Towers of Hanoi puzzle to select the items you want in the slots you want with many classic combinations blocked entirely. Many better configuration systems exist in other games going back to the 80s. All they had to do was copy one.

BAD STUFF   I really wanted to like it. I celebrated when the out of the blue update came out. but as like most greedy companies, high rez can't live with out monitizing the crap out of their game.   Where to begin, the community is toxic as hell. most people would complain 'wassn't tribes 2 and vengance the same way' no where close as to how bad it is in this game. people slam and insult eachother other petty little things and complaints. even pointing out how stacked teams are will get you removed from a server, cause the vets have no respect for new players trying to get into the game.   speakign of stacking adn vets, the small community that remains with in the game is pretty much only one of two groups of vetern players. both of which regularly pile up on one team from what I'v watched. And pummel the other players on the other while insulting them, pretending their balls are bigger then the earth cause they are all on one team.   Weapon acqusition isnt too bad, but it plays in part with the whole 'Stacking' deal. In old tribes games, you never had to unlock weapons. you joined a server, you set up your load outs and you go. no having to acquire 12000 points to buy your shocklance, no getting 8000 points to buy your mines to put down on the flag. its what kept the community freindly, I sucked to high heaven in tribes 2, but didn't matter to me. I had every thing in the game, there wassn't any thing I had to grind for? why get angery?  In tribes ascend how ever you haved to grind out XP to buy your weapons, packs, gernades, every thing except for vehicles. a patch after the out of the blue update made it easier to grind up the XP's tog et weapons but still with the need to win to get the best ammount of XP's leads to the enviroment between plays to be very toxic and not for those who were hoping to learn from teh vets. CAuse sadly it will most likely end with you getting frustrated and the vets just laughing and pointlessly seeking you out to kill you as well as slanderize you down to the personal level point of sayying things that are considerably in the zone of harresment.  I want to see the game flourish, I really wanted to relive the glory days of tribes 2 and vengance but jsut high rez screwed it up to much, they should just stick with making MOBAS cause this tribes game is a stain on the tribes name.   GOOD STUFF   BUT... not everything about this game is bad. the mechanics for stuff liek skiing, disk jumps and such are just gorgouse and fluid. and the graphics are actually not half bad for a tribes game... if only they werent wasted.   they did bring back old favorites fromt eh series, such as the original desighn of the spin fusor (But its called the 'light spin fursor' and as the name suggest, its only for light armor), as wella s shocklance, plasma gun and relativly similar model desighn for the gernade launcher from Tribes 2. to add further to that they kept up the looks of blood eagle and diamond sword armor (if you don't know what I mean. go google what a diamond sword heavy looked like in tribes 2, then look at a diamond sword heavy in ascend)   for even more nestolgia they brought back a few maps from old games! Though when playing them youl be quick to notice... they shrunk a fair bit... (when did katabatic get so small?)      Do I recommend you play tribes ascend?   Despite they nestolgia they put back into teh game. no ...I can't bare to let the vets in that game but jerks to more people looking to relive their old days. you can play it if you really wanna try but be warned, the community is more toxic then chocolate would be to a dog. You wont hear me complain about the learning curve, all tribes games are like that. Thats what made them fun! but the whole having to unlock your gear thing is what disgraces the tribes name. made the players more hostile to people trying to get on their level. rather then just joking about and explaining how to they crazy stunts they do.

Also note that this game officially has support of a dev team again and many changes are taking place. I haven't had time to go back and try it again, but when I do, I will change this review.  This game gives shame to the name Tribes if you have ever played the original version. Tribes: Ascend focuses on quick play snatch and capture mechanics with very limited ability to defend the flag other than chasing down the enemy constantly, which is very difficult due to the 10 second captures skilled players can do.  In the original 'Starsiege: Tribes', any player could set all the defenses with each team having a resource cap on the amount of defences that could be set. In Ascend, each class has their own defence abiliy and only 1 per player. So ASSUMING your team even sets down their defense ability, you have a very very small defense to block the enemy.  Another problem I have is Starseige used to actually make getting the flag difficult by putting them IN buildings with many turns and hallways so a player could not simply fly past it and grab it like in Ascend.  This game falls so short of actually being competitive it's just sad.

This was, at one point, an excellent game, one I poured a fair sum of money into, but unfortunately the developers have all but abandoned the game with many issues still left untouched, the once regular content updates that kept the game fresh are gone, and few people seem to care about it any more. Unless you really need a Tribes fix I wouldn't waste your time on it. It's a pity such a good game was destroyed by its developer.

Having played this a long time after the early 2012 hype, I can say that I see why people enjoyed this game - and why they left it. Of all the F2P games out there, the system in place here feels the most abrasive. So we essentially have a fast paced and highly competitive shooter (at least, on paper) with a unique concept, but we need to 'unlock' classes and weapons? I haven't played any of the other Tribes games, but even so I felt like I was playing a game that is a mere shell of its potential - and seeing how the developer outright abandoned it for a soulless MOBA cashgrab, I don't see it ever changing. The worst part about this game is that there are some genuinely fun and well designed parts when you get past the layers of cash shops and leveling systems, much like a puppy trapped in a sewer. It's heartbreaking, and its why I can't even recommend giving it a small trial.

In the beginning (2012) there was hype for whatever reason.  Tribes: Ascend was DOA out of beta.  It had been slowed down, perks were never considered for balance issues, weapons were released (practically weekly) too often and without any sense of incorporation in to the already existing product and were altered from being overpowered to useless in their short lifespans.  Then 2015 'Out of the Blue', which is more like 'Out of the Beta' since the game is now truly 'out of beta' considering that the 'OOTB patch' is the 'Definitive Incarnation' of Tribes: Ascend.  The games speeds were sped up across the board... In the sense that everyone can go fast, even heavies.  Now everyone has the broken perk 'Survivalist' so you can play Quake style TDM 'camp the healthkits' in every game mode and there's a large chunk of players who firmly believe that the game being slowed down like this is just the single most eSports thing to happen to T:A.  Also with 'Survivalist' integration you have infinite ammo management added to your list of things to do as a player which is supposedly not 'Crutch', because being able to endlessly fire weapons adds a lot to online FPS games. It's not like managing resources, like ammo, and health, and energy, and shields, really adds any depth to a game.  Can't spell 'Fun' without 'irony'.

This game is more or less dead by its own devices and abandoned by its developers. It had a horrible F2P model (which got changed WAY too late in its life), balancing that is anything but (automatic weapons being the biggest offender in killing player interest), 'classes' that are poorly defined to the point that they are almost indistinguishable from each other, and honestly just doesn't really offer anything that you probably haven't experienced (likely in a better form) from its prior incarnations, or other shooters for that matter (old school or *modern*)   It had potential, but this potential was never really developed.  EDIT 9/22/15: And I wouldn't hold out hope for the balance patch that is supposedly in the works that was supposed to have come out back in 2012.

Tribes: Ascend is a good way to waste some time. It has complex and interesting maps, and while there is a steep learning curve for weapons in the game, it's far more rewarding than in other games to get a kill. Sadly, it is clearly a game developed around microtransactions, and it takes an absurd amount of time to get that one weapon you've been eyeing. Due to that fact, the majority of players have moved on from Ascend, and it's slowly fading out. While not a bad game in its own right, due to the recent lack of players and neglect from the developers, I can't recommend this game.

I actuall could use my wallet here for 'skins' and gods...)  My recomendation: If you're giving it a shot, go ahead! It's still a fun, yet frustraiting game! It's Tribes. If you loved the series, you'll get some mileage out of it. But for everyone else, the time has already passed.  The game mechanics are solid, and it's still very much an enjoyable shooter. If you do get into it, look for the GOTY pack on sale, as it'll give you more than enough content for your money, and is much preferred to the grind or solo purchases.  That said, HiRez dropped support for this (among their other games) to focus on Smite, their new money-maker. While I can't entirely blame them, it still sucks. And with Tribes, it shows... the servers are mostly empty (though you can usually get a few games in without much wait) and there are no more updates.  While a lot of fun at its core, due to the ended support, lack of care from HiRez about the game and grind needed to get into it... for all by the most desperate for some Tribes-y action (I think there's an original Tribes resurgence, so go look at that instead), Tribes: Ascend is sadly a pass.

Switching to Steam version, thought I'd drop an opinion here.  This game is fun in itself, and different from most bland shooters. You go fast, fast, fast, and you shoot high explosives. And I'm afraid that's where praise must end. HiRez doesn't give you anything noticable that you can get shortly, like in Blacklight Retribution or Spiral Knights. Instead, all upgrades are crutch weapons, things a class NEEDS to operate properly, after weeks of saving up from wins. There are severe class imbalances, such as Doombringer being useless overall and Infiltrators' capabilities of killing you instantly from their cloaks, and so on. It's something to play. It's very pay-to-win, free players mostly being cannon fodder. Until these issues are fixed, I wouldn't recommend paying a cent.  It's still fun to play on occasion, hence why I haven't deleted it yet.  Edit: As of 12/13/2013, I haven't played this game in, what, a year or so? If what I read is true, they've abandoned development and the game is still subject to some very serious balancing problems, especially in that new players simply can't compete. But really, the only reason I updated this was to change the recommendation from yes to no now that Steam has a system like that.

So I started out loving this game, back in beta. It was fresh, it was exciting, it does things no other title on the market does, like skiing. A breath of fresh air, a new arcade shooter. But once you get past the initial fun, the flaws start showing up.  Physics are crap: it claims 'worlds fastest shooter,' but only in pure speed going in a slightly curved line. It's anything but fast-paced due to low gravity and weak jetpacks/acceleration (at full energy, you can't recover if you step off a platform and fall 3 feet). The effect is as though you're playing underwater.  Automatic weapons are dominant because of this lack of mobility: in a game that has little emphasis on cover, they're not fun or skillful, and 8/10 aren't even needed. This problem is compounded by the fact that bullet hitboxes -for some reason- are larger than 1-shot projectile hitboxes. Even after nerfs, they're still almost double the DPS of explosives and have no spread to curb them.  See comments for rest of rant.

TL;DR (even tho this isn't long anyway): Tribes theoretically is a waste of time on the long term, but you should have at least tried it and seen the awesome, unique mechanics this game introduced. If you've got time to spare and feel like playing around for a couple hours, this'll do great. You might get disappointed/sad once you realise how much ♥♥♥♥ the devs did outside of gameplay.    Tribes probably wrote the saddest FPS story I've witnessed.  It's so sad, I'm not gonna make a long explanation out of it. It's a story of how the most promising and fun gameplay concepts got overshadowed by ♥♥♥♥♥♥ dev decisions, especially outside of direct gameplay.  My actual recommendation: At least try this game, if you haven't. Why? Because you should have seen it. I don't think it's an actually recommendable game on the long term, but compare this game's gameplay to a lame ♥♥♥, boring CoD or whatever (those kind of shooters where the concept clearly is 'shooting > strategies'). Tribes does have a strategic part to it, but the shooting part is done in such a unique and fun way, it's ridiculous. Whenever I play a FPS that's promoted as 'fast', fun or individual and I try it, all I think is 'well, it's not Tribes'. Hardly any game has similarly entertaining and unique mechanics in it. Balance issues, a kind of p2w system, no mod support and updates that didn't add ♥♥♥♥ to the game make me not want to play this anymore, but I'll never forget the ♥♥♥♥ing sick concepts and potential this game had.

Edit: DO NOT GET THIS GAME. As of last year, Hi-Rez has stopped all support for this game, and no longer updates nor polices it. The legitimate players have long since quit en masse, leaving only cheaters and hackers to fill the now-sparsely populated servers. I've been meaning to edit this review for a while now, but I've been putting it off for later until today. Hi-Rez has abandoned one game after another to focus on their newest cash grab (at the time of this writing, they're working on Smite).  Tribes: Ascend is the fastest FPS game in the market. Everyone is encased in highly mobile power armor that lets them fight at blazing fast speed on the ground or in the air. In this game, a character running and gunning at 100 kph (62 mph for my fellow Americans) is considered slow, and skilled characters can engage in 250+ kph (155 +mph) firefights. To further complicate things, there are very few hitscan weapons in this game, and all of the automatic weapons are projectile based. A fast-paced game with a high skill ceiling.  I recommend buying the 90-day XP booster, which is on sale for 1600 gold at the time of this writing (October 22, 2012). A VIP account (one that has paid anything) gets +50% XP. The booster doubles your XP on top of the +50%, for a total of triple XP (+200%) for 90 days and +50% XP once it wears off. You also get a bonus 1,200 XP per day that the XP booster is active, giving you even more XP to spend.  Also, on Facebook, you can get 250 gold for liking it.

EDIT: The Out of the Blue patch has improved this game immensely, bringing it more in line with Tribes and Tribes 2. However, there still are some balance issues, but much more concerning is the still-dwindling player base. Hi Rez has shown they've not completely forgotten about the game, but now they need to show they're commited to actually making it a good one. Check out all the new changes, and keep an eye on the game. Hopefully things continue to improve.  An interesting title that's more a mixed bag than anything. Flashy graphics and unique mechanics provide lots of fun, but the massive xp costs for the countless amount of unlocks turns what would be a solid FPS into a frustrating grind fest. Not to mention, the learning curve is extremely steep; between learning all the weapon behaviors and skiing, there's a rather large barrier of entry for a newcomer. However, the DOTA- and CS-like difficulty is compounded by the xp grind and feeling of helplessness against those who have arguably 'better' unlocks and more time with the game. Granted, mastering skiing and grinding for the unlocks will certainly keep you coming back, the former being genuinely fun and the latter having the same addictiveness for completionists.  The classic F2P microtransation system really forces you to start pumping money in to bolster your arsenal. You'll have so little if you solely unlock through grinding that you're likely to never know what you actually prefer otherwise. For those inclined to do so can use Steam Wallet funds to purchase Tribes Gold in-game. This allows you to unlock weapons, classes and perks much faster than by grinding alone.  However, putting money into this does leave a bad taste in your mouth. The game does feel like it's slowly expiring, so spending money on the myriad of arguably better and/or necessary unlocks also quickly kills the desire to play. Having dropped $20 in my 30 hours of play has left me little fulfillment. More often than not, I'll want to play, but the sense of aversion due to the xp grind and complete chaos in pubs keeps me from hitting the play button now.  Hackers are both stupidly obvious and game breaking. One will ruin a game entirely; ironically, this is usually the best way to grind xp. Furthermore, despite the potential for large and hectic matches, even the normal 12vs12 games feel sparsely populated, every player preferring to go at it lone-wolf. This frequently results in both team having one or two players with better unlocks capping uninterrupted or camping your generator. The only time it feels like people are truly working together is when it's hardcore players stomping your team.  Vehicles also don't seem to be touched at all, another disappointment considering the amazing potential they can have. The vehicle pad screams for more attention. Of the three (yes, only three - that doesn't even fill the list space!) vehicles you can purchase during a match, two are bland, expected additions that most games in this genre will have. The Grav Cycle is the best of the three, but still pales compared to other vehicles seen in FPS games in the past decade.  I find myself picking it up every so often because despite its issues I really do want to enjoy this game. As you perfect your skiing and get better at predicting shots, there is some degree of redemption afforded the game? Those one-in-a-million shots are extremely gratifying, and high-speed chases are thrilling. Unfortunately, for a game so young, it seems to be suffering from the same fate many significantly older games are: a dwindling player base and no new official content. While Tribes fans may be able to look past the flaws to play a game bearing the series name with a modern paintjob, after a certain point the enjoyment of mid-air spinfusor directs simply can't produce enough draw to boot the game again. Whether that's after 5, 50, or 500 hours is dependent on how much you like the franchise.  Sadly, Tribes: Ascend is only really recommendable to the intensely curious who won't mind the grinding and frustration or the long-time fans who'll buy the GOTY version. For a game with so much potential, it really feels the weight of its awards have crushed it. It's had its 15 minutes of fame and has ceased being profitable for the developer. Without a support team to keep it patched, hacker free, and fresh with new content, Tribes: Ascend is simply crumbling under its own weight.  I love this game but it hates me. The Tribes franchise deserved better.

*Sigh*  This game was amazing. It was wonderful. It was, arguably, the best FPS at one time.  But Hi-Rez made Smite, and they tossed this aside like a used condom.  Servers are bad. Player base is small. There have been some very negative reddit posts made by Hi-Rez PR about the issues, and there response was basically: 'Don't like the game anymore? Go to Smite!'  So, no, don't play it. Its frustratingly laggy servers and repetitive matches are not worth playing. Its one thing if the player base is small, but disconnects and high ping do not bode well for fast movement and twitch based shooting.

Bit of a juxtaposition. A good game reminicent of Tribes 2, which I sank 8-10 hours of a day off into, but with more restrictions because of the f2p model. They have a few of the Starsiege: Tribes and T2 maps in there which is good for nostalgia, however, without the ability to mod the game, you won't get the same kind of satisfaction.   The devs have stopped updaing T:A in it's entirety, so what you see is what you get and nothing more.  Damn shame Hi-Rez abandoned this game for the obvious 'flavour of the month' MOBA style game, which I'm sure they'll abandon once that cash cow's udders dry up, as this could have been something legendary like it's predecessors.  A better free to play game would be Planetside 2, which is more Tribes, than Tribes... oddly. Just make sure your hardware is up for the resource hungry engine. At least the devs at SoE don't abandon their games.  (I downvoted because there's no point investing time and money into a game that is no longer being developed, not because the game is bad. Plus, Why would you give a company more money for an IP/Idea that wasn't theirs to begin with, which they've just thrown away?)

Basically a futuristic competative FPS with huge open maps and everyone on skis. Its a FTP + microtransaction driven game and playable without those. Its a fairly unique take on the genre, with a variety of classes each with their own use. The game's graphics aren't that good so it runs fine.  The problem is that the dev has basically abandoned the game in favor of their new FTP moba. There's a modest score of not-well-balanced maps and some of the classes can be frustratingly imbalanced on some maps over others depending on microtransacted equipment (which would otherwise take a fair amount of time to grind out).  Don't play it. There are plenty of other paid FPS games you could purchase and get more out of, unless you're craving something Sci-fi in your competative FPS or have an empty wallet.

A solid fast paced FPS that is by far the best CTF game mode in any FPS ever. The speed and intense gameplay are second to none, and the game is utterly mesmerising to play at a high level. The game however has suffered from the developers decision with additions that destroyed a lot of the games balance and ruined many of the classes roles. Before then abandoning it for another IP they had also been creating (SMITE). This is a sad thing due to the potential the game had right from the start. With a solid base like it had at launch the game could have well been one of the premiere competitive FPS games out there. So, the game looks good and it can be fun to zip around the landscape trying to line up the perfect shot to blow your opponents to bits, but there are just so many things that get in the way of enjoying the game. Some classes feel poorly balanced, the sniper class does less damage than most of the heavy classes, meaning your reward for lining up incredibly difficult shots is almost nonexistant. The 'technician' class seems like it is designed for defends generators and whatnot, but his default weapons are poory suited to dealing with heay/medium armor classes that would attack a generator. It's amost always a good idea to just choose a heavy class, because you live longer and deal the most damage. Supposedly it's balanced through lesser mobility, but that often doesn't matter in the 8 person meelee to pick up a flag or defend an objective.

Me and Tribes have a love-hate relationship I loved this game when it came out but now... The people who buy weapons and other stuff with real world money have a clear advantage over the low level guys who only have the default weapons. I also don't like the matchmaking system... up untill level 7 you can still play against low level guys like you, but when you reach level 8 you play against all of the other players that are really skilled and know the maps really well.  If you don't like pay to win games don't download this game, but if you can live with all of the pay 2 win players you will really enjoy this great game.   P.S. I played Tribes mostly from their website and only a little bit on steam.

i have played all the previous tribes games. and this one (by far) is the most simplistic and dumbed down version. There is almost no stategy or teamwork left in the series. it is all about aiming and shooting, and there are hundreds of more interesting games that have the same depth. yes there are jetpacks, skiing and slow projectile weapons, but none of benefits of mastering them, because the only way victory is just who is better at aiming. no teamwork, no strategy, and no depth.   google 'tribes 2 trailer' for a small and simplistic example of the strategy that used to be required. even from over a decade ago with sucky graphics, the gameplay exceeded tribes ascend by far.

Tribes: Ascend is a game with incredible potential, with a genius concept great weapons, and good balance. It could change the way FPS's are made. But unfortionatley it is pay to win. In order to get all the good stuff, you need to pay. And if you don't want to pay, it takes an incredibly long time to get enough XP to get the good stuff. It even takes a while to unlock all the classes. Starts out good, but after a while you realize it's more frustrating than fun.

tribes is dead... hasnt been a proper tribes since T2. although this was a better attempt then T:Vengence, i kept all the same problems.  maybe someday someone will just port T2 to a better engine and stop trying to reinvent the wheel.  aint broke dont fix it.

When this came out, it had quite a bit of promise. It looked like it would proudly carry the banner of the wonderful previous Tribes games. Sadly, it seems like the developers never put their all into it, and there simply aren't a lot of players left.

It was fun in Beta and on release, but Hirez have proved time and again that they don't care about the community playing the game. Meanwhile, the microtransactions actually provide a distinct mechanical advantage. This means if you're not willing to throw money at Hirez, enjoy getting steamrolled time and again.   Don't bother wasting the bandwidth to download, unless you want a case study in missed potential. Hopefully a developer that actually gives a ♥♥♥♥ about the game will pick up the Tribes license next.

I Really hate to see games that have so much potential and fall flat on its face. Don't get me wrong, I like the idea for this game, I really do. And for a while that game worked and had a big following, But Hi-Rez have completely ruined there own game in this case. First of all, the graphics feel like last gen graphics (Even on max settings) which isn't good seeing as how the game is only a year old, next you have bad texture pop in, lag and environmental glitches. All of which could have easily been fixed with patches and routine updates, but Hi-Rez have stopped updates for this game to focus on SMITE (Ironically, its suffering the same fate as Tribes: Ascend). But if you're willing to look past the bad graphics (Gameplay over Graphics) the game does work, skiing, vehicles, jetpacks etc. work like they are supposed to, however trying to get accustomed to using them well in a game is impossible, because the community of new players is dead, leaving only Tribes veterans, that will wipe the floor with you giving you virtually no chance to improve at your own pace. and to make matters worse, the training section is a joke, they have a few options, basic skiing, free roam, practice with bots (F.Y.I. the training with bots isn't a full match like you'd think, its just the bots running back and forth in set direction or not moving around at all) or watching youtube videos explaining the classes. To me that is just lazy. And even thought they have servers of novices only, nothing stops a level 32 veteran from connecting to the server and demolishing all the level 1-7 novices; once again stopping all progress to get better at your own pace. All in all, don't get this game, it was great at one point but unfortunately we are all a year too late from it heyday. the only way I could recommend this game is if you're a tribes veteran, which most of us are not

The developers were just terrible at operating it. In example, at one point to puchase a single primary weapon was 10.00 USD. That is absurd. Eventually it got lowered some, then as the game died, they made a get it all pack. Far too late, HiRez. You won't have any of my money.  They also stopped addressing gameplay issues and bugs, most of them being weapon balancing. Just look up what happened when the Plasma Rifle was introduced. It was eventually fixed, but from there on out it was a hillarious rollercoaster of balance problems.  I have to unfortunately change my review to 'Not Recommend'

During its release it was a spectacular phenomenon with exceptionally balanced combat mechanics and gameplay. Movement feels fluid as it ever has in the tribes series, and graphically it is a marvel with brilliant skyboxes, particle effects, and motion blur. A sheer joy, it was a rare game where being just a spectator was enjoyable.   But now, depressingly I might add, after tens of thousands of game hours spent Hi-Rez decided to shut down game development and with it any kind of support. Servers have been in a laggy mess ever sense and anything other than a pub match is impossible. Combat balance is long gone with all the added weapons for multiple classes creating upgrades rather than sidegrade options for those willing to purchase them.   Hi-Rez made a miserable mess of this game that had so much potential, and left the cult like following of it with barely a trace other than a slightly lighter wallet.

This game was great when I used to play it many years ago. The game itself provided such a unique experience. I am currently reinstalling it to see if the reviews are true that it no longer works. If it does not work, I'll have to change this to a thumbs down.  -Edit: So, I just tested it out and had a lot of issues with it. While trying to log in, it said that it didn't have connection to the server. After trying about 20 more time, I was allowed to log in. All of my unlocks were gone, but i had a ton of experience to use to unlock things. I decided to try to explore a map by myself to refamiliarize myself with the controls before trying to get into a real match. While trying to figure out how the loadout stuff works now, I 'lost connection' with the sever. Again. The odd thing was that after it kicked me back to the log in screen, it advertised that I could buy some sort of pack that would give me double experience. Wow. I have a feeling that this was not simply 'losing conneciton'. After trying to log in 30 or 40 more times I gave up. Every time that I did iit said that it did not have connection with the server.  Sadly this game will probably never recover from this... Anyway, Because of my recent experience I have to downvote it.

I would like to start this by saying that the game isn't bad in regards to controls/graphics/stability, but this games multiplayer (literally all there is aside from training) is absolutely ♥♥♥♥ing ridiculous.   If you are okay with playing a game with a steep learning curve, against players you realistically shouldn't be gaming against as a new player, and people that honestly have such a high level of skill it is atrocious they were matched against you? Feel free to download this game, and play it to your hearts content cause that is what you will get.  Tribes: Ascend doesn't have an intelligent matchmaking system, it matches anyone against anyones, and doesn't really have a way of matching new players against new players cause FOR SOME REASON no one thought of doing that. Each time I have played this game, which is far more than my steam profile is probably going to display, I have gone up against people that are FAR beyond the skill level of my fellow new players.  Despite the fact I have tried to take the time to learn this game, oh lord have I put in the effort to master it, it is realistically impossible for me to do so under the stress of playing against people FAR beyond my skill level, especially when it tends to be an entire team of skilled players. The only way I would EVER go back to this game is if they put in place a system, which a lot of multiplayer games have in recent times, that places you against people at your own levels while restricting people of a higher skill level. They could even add in rewards for people as they go up in the ranks, into higher 'tiers' of skill, and also give an incentive for not making a new account to bypass the tiered matchmaking. Until they do something like that, which I doubt they will since this game doesn't seem to have seen an update in a while, I am never going to install it again.  TLDR: Matchmaking puts you against people far beyond your skill level, this game honestly sucks entirely for that reason, and I would only come back if they had a system in place that put you against people at your own level.

The game is killed by developers. Absolutely no communication or tech support, Hi-Rez moved to Smite completely. I'm still playing it, since there are sill about 10 active servers, but I'm not putting a single cent into this game. I won't support such a ♥♥♥♥♥♥s like Hi-Rez. You may ask why I have only 24 hours in the game and talking like this. It's because devs ♥♥♥♥ed up the launcher on their Steam version, that got stuck on authenticating, so I've set it up as non-steam.

Don't get me wrong, this game is really fun, its a nice new takes on fps games, its fun. But theres some problems that I just can't look past. The Thumper is rediculously overpowered. It isn't even funny, noobs come inwith a weapon that can decimate a vetern squad. It's sad.The spinfuser isnt much better, but atleast you have to aim to a certain extent. The vehicles arent nearly as awesome as Id expect them to be. I can take a tank down no problem as a juggernaut, and its so damn expensive. Shrikes aren't any better. Grav cycles aren't terrible, they're cheap, go fast, and do plenty of pewpews, but they might as well be made from wet paper. Generator room camping is quite the problem, Ive had it where 3-4 people fly into my gen room, and hold it for the entire round, crippling my teams ability to attack/defend. The issue here is that theres too much cover inside of the generator room, the enemy can use it just as well as allies. Of course, it's been a good year since I've played this, and if its changed, I'll go ahead and update this.

If you're looking for a game that isn't bland, go find something else. Having played for only a few hours I pretty much beat all the features, quests and got a few achievments. Basically, you just spawn in an arena, and you surive.Everyone just uses the same gun. The only thing interesting about the game was sliding and leading shots with a plasma rifle. There are 3 main classes, and other than the sliding, there isn't much to do except just slide around the map looking for noobs. A below-decent game with little to do. Unless you plan on paying, which yields you only a few items which you can toy around with.

This is one of those games you'll come to play, find it fun for a couple days, then never play it again, it gets boring pretty quickly and I doubt I'll be coming back to play this anytime soon, the maps feel pretty bland for the most part, the guns are fairly decent but I think the only highlight for me is the powersliding

A very poorly balanced 'Free to Pay' game. No customization at the start. Paying players are instantly recognizable in that they are not cannon fodder, and you are. It sometimes felt like they stopped just short of having purchasable consumables that win the current game for you.

Although the 'skiing' system is original and quite interesting, a lack of better class equality and  much  better graphics (because the graphics of this game are of cube 2 level, and that's a bit of a shame for a  new  PC game), coupled with a few bugs and annoying glitches like the fact that spawn points are completely random it seems...  All in all, you can try this game if you want, well it's free after all, but in my opinion, if you want a really good free FPS game, go play Planetside 2 which is on a completely other level. (well it's not really the same budget to start with).  My final rating is 4/10, because it's not because a game is free that anything goes, even if there are some original points and ideas included in the package, I don't consider it to be enough to get more than that rating.

The little game that couldn't. Tribes: Ascend failed to bring in the perpetual revenue that the developers had hoped for it, and is now all but abandoned under the feet of the mega-success Smite. With a now faltering community, Tribes: Ascend seems to have it's days numbered.  The base game is still playable, and incredibly fun, and even worth a look, but sadly, don't expect updates, or a continuous thriving player-base.

For a time it was a pretty marvelous game, unparalleled sense of speed, fairly balanced and rewarding unlocks that skew heavily towards payment incentive but there were some reasonable deals on item packs. It was a lot of fun.  What actually made me remove the game, though, was the mandatory update process (which, despite the option being there, could NOT be disabled) that runs in the background 24/7, launches with your computer, and cannot be disabled except by command line prompt maraudery that then makes the game refuse to start because the update process isn't running. It wasn't doing anything malicious other than being there without permission, but I don't like that sort of ♥♥♥♥ on my comptuer.  Such a shame, really.

The game itself is very solid and ans some amazing mechanics. The skiing and combat is fast paced and action packed. The main problems lie in the learning curve and the cheaters. T:A offers a tutorial area and guides to get you started, but really you should just play to see what works for you. If you want to do something faster or better, there are YouTube videos of how to do it.   Hackers. They're not maggot-infested in the servers but they are a reality. Kicking people is very hard because 80% of the players in-game must agree, and no more than 2 people can vote no. Hi-Rez has 100% completely abandoned this game to work on Smite. There is no longer any form of tech support or patch fixing etc.   If you can work through the learning curve, and find games without hackers, then it's a solid game for those with the patience to play it.   However, you're looking for a fun new fps to get into, look away. This one comes with a lot of early game stress and frustration.  The F2P model is pretty good, everything in game can be purchased with in-game credits. Premium currency can buy the same weapons and upgrades, but these are balanced and not game-breaking. Everything in this game has a counter to it.

I would like to play and/or review this 'game'.. but after Steam download 2 curious things happened:  1) While installation I was told that the game need some 3rd party software to be installed. I was not told which software, how many programs or why I need them. I had to confirm this. The game installed then software which I actually don't know what it's good for or where it is installed. I just found some infos after installation in the forums.. but I'm not sure if there will stay crap software after deinstalling the game. Looks & feels more like malware instead of gaming software.  2) After installation and starting the game.. I was told that I need an external account to play the game. After clicking the 'create account' button the game freezed 5 minutes or so with curious window look. The I was able to create an account. But I was not able to login because I need to click the activation link in the email sent to me. After one day.. there is still no activation link or mail.  The videos, pictures and description looks nice.. but actually I'm not sure what this download is. I have seen just the login screen which is not working for me. Could be a game.. or malware.. or a browser.. or a mp3 player. I don't know.  I had just 0.1 hours 'ingame' at the login screen.. so I had to wait +0.1 hours to be able to write this review. LoL  I cannot recommend this game for anyone. And since other reviewers told us that the developers have stopped work on the 'game' ( means no more updates or fixes ).. I would not pay any cent into it or waste time with download or something.

If you loved the Annihilation mod (or football) from the old tribes and didnt care for the base game then you may not be able to get into this. I was one of those folks that scoffed at the plain tribes because of its lack of base defense structures or strategy beyond -Go really fast ftw-  This game is much like that but worse in some ways.   Gone are the deadly plasma & missile turrets, huge maps and large bases. Wanna repair your generator? Dont, your just wasting time with a game element that doesnt work. Your better off ignoring the inventory stations, plasma turrets and generator because everyone can move so fast that nothing can stop them. Go outside and just fight like everyone else because they already know that base utilities are useless (you spawn with all your gear instead of having to outfit yourself before you move out like old tribes so yey no strategy just GO GO GO). The weapons are not balanced imo and it seems obvious since everyone uses the same gear that is the best. Remember the laser rifle? It was feared by flag snatchers. Now its just a pathetic tribute to an old weapon because its no longer effective like the good old days.  This game really is just a twitch shooter engineered to make you spend real $ with the illusion of some base management. Couple that with a new rank system that limits what servers you can enter with a small player base, micro transactions and everything horrible that follows that MO.   If you can handle all that crap then you better have some skills son because the old vets and new blood are playing this now and they will serve you your own ♥♥♥ on a Spinfusor disc before you can say 'Shazbot!'  Very disappointing. EA Dungeon Keeper disappointing.

Do not play this or purchase it's DLC. The steam version breaks randomly and CAN NOT BE FIXED. Even if you completely re-install it. No idea what causes it but the devs have no intention of fixing it.  To play this game follow the below instructions!  1. Download and Run the following exe.  'http://hirez.http.internapcdn.net/hirez/InstallHiRezGamesEnglish.exe'   2. Create the following shortcut. 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Hi-Rez Studios\HiRezLauncherUI.exe game=200 product=10'  3. Run that shortcut, it will do all the setup & install.  If you do not create the shortcut it will try to make you purchase/launch Smite.

I played this game back in 2012 and it was pretty cool. Then Hi-Rez ditched it for their new toy Smite. Whatever, a company has to make money, I can understand. On a whim I decided to reinstall and see what they'd done with it. Downloading from their website worked fine until the game needed to install Adobe Flash of all things, which doesnt work because the specific version is an old one which Adobe doesnt allow. Fine. I uninstall and try the Steam version. The first time setup demands I restart my computer. Fine. The game launcher can't even find the servers now, but hold on! The game launcher now needs an update. Fine. This update involves another Hi Rez executable which crashes a third of the way through demanding that I restart my computer. Why in the world does this game need 7 redistributables to RUN THE LAUNCHER. Why don't they use the Steam 'First Time Setup' thing to update all this stuff instead. If you loved the Annihilation mod (or football) from the old tribes and didnt care for the base game then you may not be able to get into this. I was one of those folks that scoffed at the plain tribes because of its lack of base defense structures or strategy beyond -Go really fast ftw-  This game is much like that but worse in some ways.   Gone are the deadly plasma & missile turrets, huge maps and large bases. Wanna repair your generator? Dont, your just wasting time with a game element that doesnt work. Your better off ignoring the inventory stations, plasma turrets and generator because everyone can move so fast that nothing can stop them. Go outside and just fight like everyone else because they already know that base utilities are useless (you spawn with all your gear instead of having to outfit yourself before you move out like old tribes so yey no strategy just GO GO GO). The weapons are not balanced imo and it seems obvious since everyone uses the same gear that is the best. Remember the laser rifle? It was feared by flag snatchers. Now its just a pathetic tribute to an old weapon because its no longer effective like the good old days.  This game really is just a twitch shooter engineered to make you spend real $ with the illusion of some base management. Couple that with a new rank system that limits what servers you can enter with a small player base, micro transactions and everything horrible that follows that MO.   If you can handle all that crap then you better have some skills son because the old vets and new blood are playing this now and they will serve you your own ♥♥♥ on a Spinfusor disc before you can say 'Shazbot!'  Very disappointing. EA Dungeon Keeper disappointing.

It was a good game, but it's changed a lot since last I played, it was fine how it was before aside from the FPS drops every now and then, I mean come on, if it's only got one minor problem don't ♥♥♥♥ing reskin it and crap it out like 'WE FIXED IT' (though you didn't cause the FPS is still ♥♥♥♥♥), when I came back I noticed that I had only the starting weapons, and the starting amount of XP, all of the XP I earned by playing this laggy as hell game, with only a handful of good players that would only be on my team half the time, all of the crap I unlocked with said XP, was gone, and I seem to recall being level 16, almost level 17, with around 180,000 XP give or take, but when I came back I was only ♥♥♥♥ing level 6, all of the classes were changed to have 'default' loadouts that were just named 'loadout 1' 'loadout 2' 'loadout 3' and so and and so forth, pretty much forcing you to take the time that you could be spending playing the game and possibly having fun to look at all the weapons for each class (light, medium, and heavy, by the way) and make and rename each ♥♥♥♥ing loadout yourself, it was much better when the loadouts were already there, made and named, I could just choose a class and choose a loadout like for example I choose light class, I could choose sniper, infiltrator, assassin, or with medium, there was soldier, and engineer, and a few others (I haven't memorized all of the classes), there was brute in heavy, I can't remember the name of the other heavy class I used, but my point is, they didn't need to alter the classes, it was (almost) perfectly fine the way it was! the only thing that needed fixing was whatever was causing the random lag spikes that could ruin a perfectly good game!  TL;DR it was good, they changed it too much, now it sucks balls, and I hope whoever thought the changes were a good idea steps on a very sharp and pointy lego.

Well, for a sequel to the series it did well I think. You have a variety of classe to choose from, as well differnet customizations, so almost anyone can find a class and make it suite their playstyle. The skiing mechanic is interesting, definitely changes things up a little, but it's nothing more than a gimmick, it loses it's appeal fast. Unfortunately one of the largest issues with the game is that high level players can join servers that're set for lower ranks, causing players to get frustrated quickly. That coupled with the fact that the base design on almost every map favors an attacker makes me wonder what hirez were thinking when they made this. The graphics are nice, wouldn't say they're the best but certainly not the worst either, but you're probably better off playing some other shooter than this one. Can't recommend this game to anyone short of fans of the series.

This game didn't make a good first impression on me. My friends said it was super fun, but I didn't like it very much. I like the aspect of sliding down hills to gain momentum and using a jetpack and such, but the controls are so odd and out of the ordinary, not like any other shooter. I mean, I get that this game wanted to be different, but a lot of people who play games with a common genre are going to expect similar controls, and when you give them very random controls, it isn't very fun trying to learn a new layout. For example, I am used to jumping (or using a jetpack/flying) in other games with the space bar, but you ski using the space bar. I normally expect to sprint with shift, but instead AIMING is on shift. How does that make any sense? Most games use the right mouse button to aim. One more thing, you don't just drop a game that is still very popular just to make or work on another game. Hi-Rez started working on Smite and just dropped this game. They used to try to make the best gaming experience, but now they are working super hard on Smite, which isn't even a fun game to begin with (in my opinion). All-In-All, Hi-Rez has to learn how to manage two games at once, like Activision. They could have two teams, one for Tribes and one for Smite. Activision has Treyarch working on games to be produced every other year, and Activision has Infinity Ward working on games to produce every other year, so that a Call of Duty game is made one year by Treyarch, and then the next year by Infinity Ward. If Hi-Rez had two teams for Tribes and Smite, Tribes might actually still be a good game. Ok, my rant is over.

A year ago I wouldve given this game a 100000/10, yet I am forced to push players away from this near perfect arena shooter, as nobody else plays it. The momentum, the feeling of zooming down a hill, launching up into the sky, and jetpacking your way into the enemy base, taking out three of your opponents, stealing their flag, and capping, while still feeling like you earned, is unmatched. I do not know why HiRez made this game worse.. but they did. You cannot one-shot people anymore, a light armor can survive a mortar to the face which is not very tribes1/2-like The combat no longer requires aiming, just how fast you can switch weapons and aim in someone elses general diection With the new weapon categories you can basically just load up on explosives and win the game Its almost impossible to base raid anymore because you cant one shot people with all the turrets and mediums loaded to the teeth with explosive weapons and cant be one shot anymore Stealth is an absolute joke now because after you shocklance someone.. they dont die and you are stuck with your thumb in your dischole with no energy as they go airborne and rain death on you with their arsenal of explosive weapons they can switch to instantly Flag capping is a whole nother story, sniping does junk for damage now and chasing revolves around you already having a good speed already and happen to be traveling in the same direction or your flag is long gone. On top of everything else these new maps are HUGE and you cant even zoom in very far. HiRez really should stick to MOBAs and sell off the Tribes IP to people who know what they are doing

I decided to try it out because it looked pretty neat. After a few hours of playing capture the flag I realized how frustrating killing the enemy flag carrier was. They may not be able to regen health, but their jet fuel still regens, too quickly I might add. The same as every player. The jets are more of an annoyance than a cool feature. The weapons arent really accurate enough to hit decent shots unless you use explosives. I don't see many people using the regular guns. Probably because you can't hit your mark 85% of the time with them. I would only reccomend this to a player who has the patience to hunt down a flag carrier for 14 minutes just to be able to plant your teams flag again to score a point.  This was an entire waste of 2 and a half hours.

Short review: Game offers a unique movement system that is really fun, definetly the best part of the game. What makes me not recommend it? The weapon balance. It seems like the only weapon that is really viable and strong is the 'spinfusor' - a weapon that fires a spinning grenade that detonates on impact (player or ground). All other weapons DONT EVEN NEARLY have the same amount of damage like this weapon. Even those weapons that are relatively hard to use, like the sniper rifle ARE NOT REWARDING if you hit an enemy, not even if you hit them in the head.  The Spinfusor will still outdamage it, even if not a direct hit.  TL;DR Move on to the next game, this one will only keep you busy for a few minutes until you realize only 1 weapon is viable.

so i attempted to play this game; i firstly had an issue with some manner of Hirez varification, or whatever, before i could even begin to play the game (this was already annoying). it ran for about 10 minutes (during which i was utterly bored due to lack of players on any of the servers) and then it crashed. i attempted to re-install but the game just wasn't on my games list anymore. it seems as though they have just given up on a potentially good game and left it to whither and die in the dust. pathetic.

How do I start with this game. First of all, the name. Tribes Ascend? Makes it sound like an epic game, but in reality its just a bunch of super space soldiers fighting over nothing, while sliding down hills as their main mode of transportation. Nothing says manlier than sliding down hills, right? Second of all, I can't tell if this takes place in the future or the future future. What year is it? Why does it look primitive yet futuristic? There is no story, no timeline, nothing. For all we know this is a lost episode of Scooby Doo. All in all, I'd say give this game a pass. No clear storyline, and its kinda of boring at times when it should be action packed. It was a disappointing experience.

Either way, games pay to win style, but you only ever need the starting gun, get the thing first, prehaps flag, then ski around the whole map either never not skiing slow or just fly the rest of it and your almost uncatchable. Its really initiative and guess work for this game. No aiming required.

I just had to write a review before I uninstalled: This game is the dumbest f**cking game I've played in a while, and I just reinstalled CSGO. I read the article on Kotaku and thought I'd check it out, which is dumb on my part because screw Kotaku. Just another bullsh*t free-to-play that you have to spend time making an account (yay for more spam emails?), verifying this or that (which by the way, go to your redist folder [common>Tribes>binaries>redist] and uninstall then reinstall 'InstallHirezService' because its the only way you can get this dog turd game to even get past the lauch splash page, if you even can get to that point), then finding a server that has like 2 people, and putting up with the PS1 quality graphics. Dont bother, there's better games out there, if free-to-play is your bag of crisps.

Sure, the title says Tribes... but the vast landscapes, the fair gameplay, the skill > who has the bigger gun, completely gone.  I played this in Beta, it had promise... it wasn't all the way Tribes yet, hoping they would fix things. It's worse, now with private servers, you'll be fighting to find a decent game more than you'll actually be fighting. It's ludacris when people can pile 7 vs 1, and they have absolutely no shame in it. Why? Because if you win, you get more points. More points = Bigger gun. Course, Hi-Rez offers the quick and dirty Pay-2-Win route as well, so you can get points faster on your extremely over balanced team.  If the game is in full release, not Beta, why am I still seeing so many updates that crash the Steam version.   Don't even get me started about the egos and aimbots...  tl;dr Tribes: Ascend... with more prideful ♥♥♥♥♥♥, cheap exploits, and all the fun sucked away.   The more you play this, the more you wished people still played Tribes 1 or 2.

Old Review... -------------------- Amazing Game, Large learning curve but one of the best F2P games available. Fans of the original two tribes games wont be disappointed.  Update ---------- After 3 hours I got the game too run once on Windows 10 in compatibility mode. Unfortunately, when I was searching for my password (Couldn't Copy and Paste My Password) it crashed in a way that causes the video card drivers to continually crash, reload, crash, reload, crash. It essentially makes my machine so completely un-usable with monitors loosing sync, grey screens, and artifacts start showing. These crashes required a full system restart to fix.   Another time it crashed with the direct3d crash. This one will allow me to terminate the tribes app using the task manager. Unfortunately, It doesn't shut the entire app down. I can't find the app that is playing music, it shows no activity that I can see. I suspect its a flash video, but I can't find it and had to restart the whole machine.  I maybe able to get it to run long enough to play a game. But Ive had enough. I doubt they will fix this. Don't think the game was a commercial success. Was suprised to see they did update it awhile ago. People don't like the new update. I can't comment because I can't play.  Unfortunately the old positive feedback I left has got to be negative. Can't even get to the point where I see a server list so I don't know if anyone is even playing it. Sadly, Just save yourself time and play a different game.   Sorry that this brand has been mishandled so poorly. Tribes 2 would probably have been put 3nd on a list of top FPS games of all times. Tribes Ascend was a fun return to the idea of jetpacks and skiing.   Sadly it is gone.  Update 2 ------------- After uninstalling using steam, I checked my SSD drive where it installed too find that it never uninstalled. Sadly, When I attempted to use Hi-Rez's uninstall it never worked and I had to end up deleting the directory.   There is multiple issues with this. First, I set my Steam Install Directory to my HD on D Drive. Unfortunately it installs on C drive regardless. This can fill up small SSD's with games rarely used.  Second, without proper uninstall, I can not remove all the references in the registry or other installed requirements. It leaves my machine with allot of crap.  Very Sad that I ever attempted to play this game. What a waste of time.

Too good to be true. Everything a fps should have and even more. Well balanced classes, all guns are balanced and a fair unlock stystem. 9/10 The gamemodes are a bit confusing the first times you play.  EDIT: Everything I said before has been made untrue. They ♥♥♥♥ed the classes, they ♥♥♥♥ed the guns, they ♥♥♥♥ed teh unlocks, they ♥♥♥♥ed the gamemodes, they properly ♥♥♥♥ed it for no reason. Hi-Rez are literally the worst developing company possibly on the planet. They murdered Global Agenda for Tribes, they murdered Tribes for Smite and i'm legitimately terrified they'll murder Smite for Paladins.  LET'S GO THROUGH THE REASONS WHY THIS IS ♥♥♥♥: 1. TRIBES WAS GREAT  Tribes was a fun high octane shooter with good classes, etc etc. Smite is one of my favorite games of all time, it's insanely fun and I'm psychoticly obsessed with it. Smite was super successful, as was Tribes. Tribes even got multiple GOTYs, and was a huge commercial and critical success. Smite didn't hit their benchmark of Tribes with the critical success, but went above anything expected for the commercial section. Paladins so far has recieved literally no hype or excitement. No-one knows anything about it, and it's been left in the ditch with things like Prey 2(pre-E3 2016) and other such games.  2. STANDARD PROBLEMS  People spent literally hundreds on Tribes, and the weaponry was expensive both in game with earned currency and bare dolla bills. What happened afterwards? After they deleted more than half of the classes, weapons, gamemodes, and 90% of the playerbase, no-one got any compensation for all the money they spent there. And that's a problem with any game like this. BUT. BUT. League of Legends has been going longer than Tribes, so how has it been going longer? Updates, the team caring about their game, and always supplying it with lotsa dolla. But tribes was huge on virtual currency, and Hi-Rez didn't put any artistic love or care into it, so they killed it and left people with all of their pixels, then deleted most of it and kept not giving a ♥♥♥♥ to finding a ♥♥♥♥ to give about these people. It's a problem with any multiplayer focused games with tons of skins etc. When it dies, the money goes with it. But CS:GO is still going cos it makes money, and people still rave about it. League Of Legends is still going because it makes money and people still rave about it. Tribes was still going and people were still raving about it, but Hi-Rez were like a zookeeper throwing a new toy to the tigers. The tigers liked their old toy better, and at most paid attention to the new toy. So instead of replacing that old toy and buying a newer one, they took the old toy, put it in front of the tigers and shot it with a shotgun, then shot 2 of the tigers as well, and put the new toy inside instead.  3. THIS WENT REALLY OFF TOPIC  This went from reasons why Hi-Rez is ♥♥♥♥ to an analogy about Tigers and shotguns.  4. HI-REZ ARE ♥♥♥♥  Basically they kill old games people like to force people into a new game, and i'm afraid they'll do for a 3rd time.  5. I JUST REALLY LIKE THESE SUBTITLES  I have no clue what this is becoming.   IN CONCLUSION:  ♥♥♥♥ Hi-Rez.
